required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Clinical Effectiveness of Propolis Extracts as Food Supplements in Patients With SARS-CoV-2(COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Clinical Effectiveness of Propolis Extracts as Food Supplements in Patients With SARS-CoV-2(COVID-19)

lead_sponsor.agency: Trabzon Kanuni Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Trabzon Kanuni Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Primary purpose: To investigate the effect of propolis, a food supplement product, on healing parameters in patients with COVID 19. Secondary purpose: To provide a new supportive treatment in Covid 19 treatment. In the present study to examine the effect of the use of propolis on healing parameters (laboratory and imaging) in patients with COVID 19; Propolis, which has antiviral properties, has also been used in humans in the COVID19 pandemic as of 2020. However, in these studies, an alcohol-soluble extract of propolis was used. Despite the disadvantages of its use in alcohol, it is clear that water and olive oil extracts of Propolis are safer for humans. Therefore, water extracts of propolis will be used in the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: first group treated with water extracts of propolis second group treated with olive oil extracts of propolis including perga third group treated with no bee product

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Lung Tomography Findings(Peripheral ground-glass opacities) at one week
Change from Baseline ESR findings at one week
Change from Baseline CRP findings at one week
Change from Baseline D-Dimer findings at one week
Change from Baseline Troponin findings at one week
Change from Baseline sO2 findings at one week
Change from Baseline CBC findings at one week

arm_group.description: Patients given 2 ml of aqueous propolis extract (50mg / ml) orally 3 times a day for 1 week

arm_group.arm_group_label: olive oil extract of propolis including perga
arm_group.description: Patients given 1 ml oily propolis extract (64 mg / ml) + 1 ml oily perga extract (120 mg / ml) orally 3 times a day for 1 week
control group (patients not given any investigational product)

intervention.description: Propolis may be blocked virus entry to cells, and some receptor binding and some cell signal molecules
intervention.arm_group_label: olive oil extract of propolis including perga

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over the age of 18 who do not need a ventilator who are inpatient in the Covid service
- Patients under the age of 60 who do not need a ventilator who are inpatient in the Covid service
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients do not have oral intake
- patients whose informed consent form is not approved
- patients who need a ventilator
- pregnant women
- children

overall_official.affiliation: Trabzon Kanuni Education and Research Hospital

facility.name: Trabzon Faculty of Medicine , Health Science University

reference.citation: Berretta AA, Silveira MAD, Cóndor Capcha JM, De Jong D. Propolis and its potential against SARS-CoV-2 infection mechanisms and COVID-19 disease: Running title: Propolis against SARS-CoV-2 infection and COVID-19. Biomed Pharmacother. 2020 Nov;131:110622. doi: 10.1016/j.biopha.2020.110622. Epub 2020 Aug 17. Review.

Lima WG, Brito JCM, da Cruz Nizer WS. Bee products as a source of promising therapeutic and chemoprophylaxis strategies against COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2). Phytother Res. 2021 Feb;35(2):743-750. doi: 10.1002/ptr.6872. Epub 2020 Sep 18. Review.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Trabzon Kanuni Education and Research Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data will not be shared.
